title: Astronomy Simulation-Based Collaborative Learning Course: Enhancing Multimodal Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary astronomy concepts and competency in online learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners collaborate in a virtual astronomy simulation environment using personal devices, engaging in open-ended problem-solving activities that explore diverse learning pathways. The initial phase encourages individual inquiry, gradually shifting focus to collective knowledge construction.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the motion principles of solar system celestial bodies with over 80% accuracy using astronomical simulation tools.
Learners maintain joint attention with peers during three or more collaborative tasks while discussing concepts.
Learners present group problem-solving strategies in a logical structure of three or more stages through multimodal (text/audio/gesture) interactions.
At the end of the six-month course, learners achieve a rubric-based competency level of four or higher in deriving scientific conclusions from simulation data.

resources: Multimodal Interaction Logging and Analysis System
Learner BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Guide Document

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
